intro: Triodia plumosa, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a perennial grass native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth and wiry, spiky leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and resilience to harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically borne in spike-like clusters. Triodia plumosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
